ETYMOLOGY: From Latin ambiguitas 'doubtfulness', from ambiguus 'doubtful, wavering' (from ambi- 'both, around' + agere 'to drive').

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The quality of being open to more than one interpretation; inexactness, especially in language.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 模棱两可；不明确；歧义；含糊不清的性质
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The ambiguity of the phrasing made it hard to tell what the politician really meant.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 措辞的模棱两可使得很难分辨这位政治家真正的意思。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: An ambiguous word, statement, or situation that can be understood in more than one way.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 含糊不清的言语；模棱两可的说法；歧义处；不明确的情况
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: His speech contained several ambiguities that puzzled the audience.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他的演讲中含有几处模棱两可的表达，令听众感到困惑。
